meanings.definition: relating to or concerned with the study of ecological processes in agricultural systems
meanings.sent1: The researchers conducted an agroecological study to understand how nature interacts with farming practices.
meanings.sent2: Farmers are increasingly adopting agroecological methods to improve the sustainability of their crops.
meanings.sent3: The agroecological approach to farming made the cows start dancing in the fields!
meanings.sent4: Her agroecological mindset bloomed like a colorful garden in the world of agriculture.
meanings.sent5: The agroecological perspective painted a vibrant picture of harmony between nature and farming.

meanings.definition: promoting sustainable agriculture through ecological principles and practices
meanings.sent1: The organization's agroecological initiatives aim to support farmers in adopting eco-friendly practices.
meanings.sent2: By implementing agroecological techniques, the farm was able to reduce its environmental impact.
meanings.sent3: The agroecological approach to farming turned the fields into a buzzing hive of productivity!
meanings.sent4: Her agroecological efforts blossomed like flowers in the garden of sustainable agriculture.
meanings.sent5: The agroecological solutions provided a green path towards a more sustainable future.

meanings.definition: a method of farming that integrates ecological principles to enhance productivity and sustainability
meanings.sent1: The farmers decided to switch to agroecological farming to improve their crop yields.
meanings.sent2: Agroecological practices focus on creating a balanced ecosystem within the farm.
meanings.sent3: The agroecological farm became the talk of the town with its flourishing crops.
meanings.sent4: In the world of agriculture, agroecological methods are like a secret recipe for success.
meanings.sent5: The agroecological approach transformed the farm into a thriving paradise of sustainability.
